meanings.definition: Covered with or full of bushes
meanings.sent1: The forest was the bushiest I had ever seen.
meanings.sent2: The park's bushiest areas were perfect for hiding during the game.
meanings.sent3: Trying to find my way through the bushiest part of the garden was like a maze.
meanings.sent4: Her hair was so tangled and bushiest, it looked like a wild jungle.
meanings.sent5: The bushiest section of the trail was teeming with wildlife.

meanings.definition: Having the most bushes or shrubs
meanings.sent1: The bushiest yard on the block won the neighborhood garden competition.
meanings.sent2: The bushiest corner of the yard provided a cozy spot for the rabbits.
meanings.sent3: The bushiest part of the hedge seemed to be hiding a secret entrance.
meanings.sent4: His beard was the bushiest I had ever seen, resembling a small forest.
meanings.sent5: The bushiest part of the park was a favorite spot for picnics.

meanings.sent1: The bushiest area of the forest was almost impassable.
meanings.sent2: The bushiest section of the garden needed some serious pruning.
meanings.sent3: The bushiest part of the trail was like a jungle adventure.
meanings.sent4: Her room was the bushiest in the house, with plants everywhere.
meanings.sent5: The bushiest part of the park was a haven for birds and insects.
